paragraph.S: High Water Park and Play does not get any better than this! Although it is large it is really flushy so watch the corners of the wave on the surge as they tend to disappear. Not for the faint of heart this feature comes in at 35,000 cfs and gets better with more water. Be sure to bring a camera.

name.S: Spokane River near Post Falls, ID

paragraph.S: Trailer Park Wave is a favorite amongst locals. At prime flows it is a wave hole and any wave, hole, or combo moves becomes possible. Below the prime flow range the feature is still surfable, but it does start to get shallow. If not careful it is possible to hit the rock that forms the feature when attempting vertical moves. Above the prime flow range Trailer Park becomes a small breaking wave that is good for spins and small blunts. Trailer Park is a unique feature in that it sits just upstream of where the South/Center Channels and the North Channel of the Spokane River come together, and below the dam of Lake Coeur d’Alene. If the Dam operators are releasing to much flow into the North Channel it will increase the pool height of the water in the South Channel and completely wash out the Feature. Check the link below or call the phone number to find out the flow differential. Prime is for the North Channel to only be providing 5% of the total flow on the Gauge (i.e. 4,000cfs on the gauge, 200 in the North Channel and 3800 in the South Channel). When the North Channel providing more than 25% of the flow on the Gauge, than feature will barely be a small green wave (i.e. 5,000 cfs on the gauge, 1,000 in the North Channel, and 4,000 in the South Channel). Avista daily updated hotline (509) 495-8043.

tricks.S: Anything is Possible!, Spins, Cartwheels, Loops, Back Loops, Blunts, Helix, McNasty, Phonix Monkey

paragraph.S: Corbin Wave is a large, fast, dynamic, and steep wave that provides some exciting rides. It is definitely a favorite that locals look forward to every spring when the snow melt provides the needed flows. Although the eddy will service you right onto the wave, it and the swirly eddy fence downstream of the wave can intimidate some new boaters. Eddy service is a large eddy on river right, and if this eddy is missed there are multiple other river right eddies just around the corner.

tricks.S: spins, clean spins, blunts & back blunts, air screws, pan ams, helix, pistol flips

features.S: easy access, good eddy service, big whirlpools, watch out for wood in the flow!

description.S: The wave is still forming and will feel slightly less retentive.
The wave starts to periodically surge green and the surfer right shoulder starts to lose shape.

paragraph.S: This hole has a tendency to get very retentive in the low 20,000's. Locals tend to shift up to Corbin wave for prime flows in this range.

Uniform hole that when it is at the prime flow, any trick becomes possible. Below the prime flow range the holes gets smaller and shallower. This makes it slightly harder to set up and initiation for vertical moves should be further back in the pile to avoid hitting the rock. Above the prime flow range the hole starts to become more of a breaking wave that is great for spins and small blunts.

tricks.S: Spins, Loops, Cartwheels, Lunar Orbit (@ prime flows), McNasty (@ prime flows), Phonix Monkey (@ prime flows), Side Surf, Carving, Small Blunts, Back Blunts

features.S: easy access, great eddy service with a very large eddy on river right

paragraph.S: Top wave (far river right) is better at the lower range, bottom wave better at higher range

At prime flow Mini Climax is a fast and dynamic breaking wave with good eddy service on river left. At high flow it becomes a steep green wave that provides for some long fun and carving front surfs if you have a long boat.

tricks.S: spins, blunts, back blunts, cartwheels (with proper timing)

features.S: easy access, good eddy service on river left

paragraph.S: Zoo Wave is a small dynamic wave that is a touch more wave hole on surfer left, has a breaking wave shoulder on surfer right, and opens up the potential for hole or wave moves depending on where you set up. This dynamic wave will keep you on your toes carving from shoulder to shoulder to ride the ever-changing sweet spot. Above the prime flow range the wave and hole start to become a breaking wave that is great for some fun soul surfing with long front surfs and spins. To access the wave park at the Mirabeau point Trail head for the Centennial Trail and walk-up stream about half a mile. Turn down to the river just before Mile Marker #10 (painted on the trail and a mile post on the side of the trail). The wave sits just left of center and should be obvious.

tricks.S: spins, blunts & back blunts, cartwheels, loops (occasionally)

description.S: Upper End-A little more flat but still breaking and good for a long boat surf.

paragraph.S: Constricted wave, with lower water clarity than the other features in the area.

tricks.S: shoulder to shoulder carving, spins, blunts, back blunts, Pan Am (if you are lucky)

description.S: The shoulders of the wave are surgy and make it difficult to time the various tricks.
The center pile starts to become smaller and less retentive. Forcing the paddler to be on their game in order to prevent washing off.

paragraph.S: Just a short drive from Spokane, the Dirty Mother Wave is a river wide wave in a scenic basalt canyon setting on Latah Creek that only comes in for a short period during spring runoff and heavy rains. It is a river wide green wave that rarely breaks but is steep enough for an enjoyable soul surf. The surfer left shoulder provides for some good clean spins and small blunts. Long boats tend to do better on this wave and there is enough room to spin them. At the right flow one can get some good long rides in a short play boat. Eddy service is river left and it is a very large eddy. Make sure you are ready for some solid forward strokes to get out onto the steeper part of the wave in river center. Parking can be an issue. Park just upstream of the wave in a wide pull out next the guard rail. The land next to the parking area and the wave is private property, but the landowners have given permission for us to cross it to access the wave. When using this spot as a park and play feature, please try to reduce the impact to the land and make sure that parking does not create issue for traffic passing by on Valley Chapel Rd.

tricks.S: long front & back soul surfs, spins (left shoulder), small blunts (left shoulder)

description.S: The wave gets smaller and extra effort is needed to load the wave.
The wave remains green but is steep and fast, and much easier to load from the eddy.
